title: (x) "Madea's Family Reunion" movie poster - H&FJ Leviathan {Yves}
content:
I saw this font on a poster for the Movie Madea’s Family Reunion. Anyone recognize it? I’m trying to find a font with character and a slight retro (60’s/70’s) feel.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112163807im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font%20sample.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Summerville's script sign - (similar to) Hemlock/Adpata Script (Gideion) {Mike Y}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112163807/http:/typophile.com/node/19181 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Fontleech logo slab serif w/ characteristic ink traps - Kontrapunkt {Lauri} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112163807/http:/typophile.com/node/19206 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kwebb

comments.content: [H&FJ Leviathan](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112163807/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/leviathan/index.html), _“the gothic (sans serif) member of [The Proteus Project](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112163807/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/proteus/index.html), a collection of four interchangeable type families designed in different nineteenth century styles.”_

Somewhat in the same vein — [Eric Olson](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112163807/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Eric%252BOlson)’s chunky [Maple](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112163807/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=PRC.123352.0.0).
You nailed it! Thanks (as usual) for the help.
at least I had the right foundry... lol
